column4: most likely you changed an important config file, like ~/.gnomerc so that it now causes you to exit as the first action taken upon login.  Try logging in from the consle to investigate. (alt-shift-F1 to get to the 1st console.  the GUI is on F7)
I think the design of the PC disk partitioning doesn't allow you to remove intermediate extended (= numbered higher than 4) partitions
because to reach each extended partition, you must read the boot block of the previous extended partition.
it should be possible to delete intermediate partitions by copying the boot block of the subsequent partition but perhaps gparted isn't yet capable of that.
